PV Getter¶

The Getter class provides an ipywidgets interface to help getting the PV value using a Jupyter Notebook. It shows:

  • a button to get the PV value

Getter example in a Jupyter notebook.¶

Using Jupy4Syn PV Monitor module¶

Usage of Python class using basic PV Getter fields.

class jupy4syn.PVGetter.PVGetter(name, config=<jupy4syn.Configuration.Configuration object>, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Constructor

Parameters
namestr

Name of the PV (e.g. “IOC:m1”) to get a value, or name of the mnemonic defined in config.yml (e.g. “solm1”) to get a value

configConfiguration, optional

Configuration object that contains Jupyter Notebook runtime information, by default Configuration()

Examples

>>> config = Configuration()
>>> config.display()
>>> pv_getter = PVGetter(config)
>>> pv_getter.display()
